intro: Gomphandra coi, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and well-drained soils, often in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are usually leathery and dark green, while its flowers are white or pale pink, adding to its ornamental value. Gomphandra coi is adapted to cold climates and is often found in areas with limited sunlight.
